course.subject: LIFS
course.name: General Biology I
course.description: This course targets science students not having taken HKDSE 1x Biology or AL/AS Biology. It provides students with a general overview of fundamental biology: basic characteristics of life (the chemistry of life, cells), vital life processes (respiration, photosynthesis, genetics), essential concepts of evolution and ecology, and so on.
course.exclusions: Level 3 or above in HKDSE 1x Biology, a passing grade in AL/AS Biology

reviews.author: navI
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to what was being taught in HKDSE syllabus, including:
- basic characteristics of life (the chemistry of life, cells)
- vital life processes (respiration, photosynthesis, genetics)
- essential concepts of evolution and ecology
Overall, the content and concepts are not really difficult but you must spend time in understanding them in order to have good performance.

50% for both midterm and final

For the last two topics, you better memorize the category of biological entity. They will be examined in the final.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I will give a C for Raymond Wong's teaching and an A for Eugene Hung's teaching. I can sense that Raymond Wong was a knowledgeable person and know a lot of things, but he tended to discuss things out of the syllabus and I found it difficult to chase up.

Eugene Hung is a good lecturer. He will explain the concepts in  a way that you can easily understand and even answer the questions if you paid enough attention.
reviews.comment_grading:
It seems like it is using absolute grading since they gave:
A+: 91-100;
A: 86-90.99;
A-: 81-85.99;
B+: 76-80.99;
B: 71-75.99;
B-: 66-70.99;
C+: 61-65:99;
C: 56- 60.99;
C-: 51-55.99;
D: 34-50.99;
F: 0-33.99
for the course. Lucky enough, I got 91 point something and turned out got an A+.

Reminder: some questions in exams are quite subtle
reviews.comment_workload:
You don't have to hand in any assignment. It will be better if you attend the lectures since Eugene will offer you a bonus point of 0.5 in the overall course score if you can answer any question correctly in his lectures.

*****My A+ was rescued by answering questions in Eugene's lecture

reviews.author: kenwong1840
reviews.comment_content:
總共有7個Topic，基本上topic 1-3就係d DSE嘅chem教過嘅野同少少好簡單bio野。而topic 4-6就係講述DNA，RNA，生物多樣性等較為深入嘅bio野，整體內容上會比DSE bio更為深入。
Topic 1 Chemical Nature of Living Things
Topic 2 Spatial Definition of an Organism
Topic 3 Self Material Production & Energy Acquisition by Living Things
Topic 4 Determination of Form and Function of an Organism
Topic 5 Making of a New Life
Topic 6 Differences among Living Individuals
Topic 7 Variety of Living Things on Earth
reviews.comment_teaching: 個prof都幾好人，會仔細咁答你d問題，上堂好少有overrun嘅情況，基本一定會準時落堂。
reviews.comment_grading:
個grad有4part：mid term ，final，individual project，以及class participation（bonus point）。
其中mid term佔總分嘅37.5%，final佔總分嘅52.5%，individual project佔總分嘅10%。
而bonus point就會根據你上堂嘅表現而俾，最多5分。（即係計總分時額外加5%）

mid term考topic 1-3，final考topic 4-6，全部open book，mid term考過嘅野final唔會考返。mid term同final都係全mc，mid term 有50題，final有70題。

呢個course採用absolute grading，大約5分升一個grad。90分或以上A+，85分或以上A，如此類推，低於40分就F。

想要靚grad請喺mid term發力同上堂努力答問題，只要你中學有讀過chem，mid term有8-9成唔係難事，同時因為呢個course採用absolute grading，5分bonus point可以直接幫你升一個grad。
reviews.comment_workload: 基本上冇功課，今年份project係比較疫苗對變種病毒嘅效力，基本上只要上網抄資料同抄上堂用嘅power point嘅野就做完。

reviews.author: grqm
reviews.comment_content:
Before the midterm (taught by Wong):
Chemistry of living things, cell theory, energy (ATP) and cellular respiration

Post-midterm by Hung:
Cell division, DNA & genetics, ecology
which I thought were much harder, especially DNA & genetics

If you aren't going to study life sciences, or you know nothing about biology, I think it would be a better idea to take 1030 or 1930 instead.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I never went to the lectures. But they were video recorded and uploaded to Canvas.

It could be that the lectures were boring, or maybe I just didn't like biology.
reviews.comment_grading:
Each of the midterm and final exam (non-cumulative) accounted for the half of the course grade. Each had 50 multiple choice questions.

In the midterm, all but four questions were picked directly from the textbook.

The final exam questions were *a lot* harder. Half of them had one or more answers. Most questions were about the very details from the lecture slides so it was more like a test of memorisation, not understanding.

A+ (>= 90), A (85-89.75), A- (80-84.75), B+ (75-79.75), B (70-74.75), B- (65-69.75), C+ (60-64.75), C (55-54.75), C- (50-54.75), D (40-49.75), F (<40)
The mean was 61 with a s.d. of 14.

I studied for around three days before each exam. Got 1 s.d. above mean in the midterm; 0.3 sd above in the final, and 0.8 sd above mean in the total score. Ended up with a B. Crappy grading comparing to courses at a similar level like PHYS1001 and CHEM1004.
reviews.comment_workload: Light. All this course required was memorisation.

reviews.author: Richard Kim
reviews.comment_content:
- basic characteristics of life (the chemistry of life, cells)
- vital life processes (respiration, photosynthesis, genetics)
- essential concepts of evolution and ecology

Overall, the content and concepts are not difficult, but in order to get a good grade, you have to clearly understand the concepts and be able to memorise the lecture notes.

reviews.comment_teaching:
I will say the concepts of the lecture was quite well explained, so if you pay enough attention, you will easily be able to follow through the class.

However, since the grade of this course mostly comes from midterm exam and final exam, the main focus is to understand the concepts in class, and spend time memorising them.
reviews.comment_workload: Not too much workload, just prepare well for midterm and final exams, and you will be fine! Good luck.

reviews.author: Candy626
reviews.title: Decent Course
reviews.comment_content:
I am lazy so I won't include a detailed content list here.

Topics include introductory chemistry, cell structure, translation, transcription, etc.
Due to the pandemic, a special topic on vaccines was also included.

I find the topics quite interesting even though I will not become a life science major. The amount of content is quite large, but this is expected for any life science course.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both instructors are ok.
Both of them are very knowledgeable and patient. They don't mind answering your questions for half an hour after lectures.

Dr. Tang is very kind to student and talks in a friendly tone. She also play songs before lectures. However, she teaches a bit slowly and lectures are a bit boring. Note that she takes attendence using iPRS. If you decide to not attend her lessons, her lectures slides are clear and good for revision, although quite lengthy.
Overall, she feels like a decent secondary school biology teacher.

Dr. Hung is much more serious. He also doesn't allow people to talk during lectures (even discussions on related topics are not allowed).
His voice is low and teaching speed is even more slower than Dr. Tang's. Therefore, his lectures are very boring. However, if you concentrate, you can actually learn a lot. And you better attend his lectures, as his lecture notes only contains the main points, and many details are only mentioned in lecture. Also, you get 0.5 grade points (at most 5 points) if you can answer/raise a question in lecture. You can go up a subgrade if you ask enough questions.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading, but cut-offs are determined by the performance of students in that semester.

Overall Score = Participation Mark (before Mid-Term Exam) + Mid-Term Exam Score x 0.75 + Final Exam Score x 0.5 + Individual Project Score + Bonus Points

Grade cut-offs:
A+: >=93
A: 87-92.75
A-: 81-86.75
B+: 75-80.75
B: 69-74.75
B-: 63-68.75
C+: 57-62.75
C: 51-56.75
C-:45-50.75
D: 33-44.75
F: <33
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very light.

No homework before mid term.
One individual project on DNA decoding that can be done in few hours.

If you attend all the lectures, you can probably understand the content.
Make sure you reserve a few days for revision before mid term/final exam, as a lot of stuff need to be memorized.

reviews.comment_workload:
The workload is quite light at first since most of the content taught was trivial (I didn't take biology in DSE). I'd give an A for the workload before mid-term. Just spend a day or two before midterm and you will be fine.

However, the content after mid-term started to get more complicated for me. Requires much more effort to study for the final exam. I'd give a D for the workload after mid-term (because I performed poorly in finals).

reviews.author: LunaAshley
reviews.title: 挑戰人類記憶極限: 前傳 (challenge to limits of human memory: prologue)
reviews.comment_content:
Jessica Tang: (midterm)
1. The study of life
2. The chemical basis of life
3. The molecules of life
4. Cell structures and function
5. Biological membranes: structure and function
6. Energy and enzymes
7. Cellular respiration

Eugene Hung: (final)
1. Determination of form and function of an organism
2. Making a new life
3. Differences among living individuals
4. Variety of livings on earth (skipped in favor of special topic)
Special topic: viral infection - immune responses, prevention & treatment

chem background is key. phys background helps out a bit too in the midterm.

There's also a project worth 5%:
"
In this project, you are expected to work out a DNA sequence of 15 bases that codes for a given sequence of 5 amino acids in a protein, and 4 single-base changes in these 15 bases that result in specific changes in amino acid coding. Following the convention, all amino-acid sequences are given with the amino-terminus on the left and carboxyl-terminus on the right. The sequence of 5 amino acids in the "original" protein is shown at the top followed by the 4 different "mutant" amino-acid sequences that are encoded by 4 mutant DNA sequences each of which contains one of the following mutations in the 15-bases sequence: single missense base substitution, single nonsense base substitution, single-base deletion and single-base insertion. Based on this information, determine and report the original and 4 mutant sequences of the 15 bases. For the base-substitution and insertion mutant sequences, highlight the mutated bases using boldface letters. For the deletion mutant sequence, highlight the 2 bases flanking the deleted base with boldface letters. For each mutant sequence, name the kind of mutation it contains (i.e. missense, nonsense, insertion or deletion). Finally, write a possible 15-base sequence that contains a silent mutation from the original 15-base sequence, with the mutated base highlighted with a boldface letter. For all the required DNA sequences, write only the coding strand sequence with 5'-end on the left and 3'-end on the right.
_____________________________________________________________

Here is an example: If the given amino acid sequences are
Original:    Met    Ala    Asp    Lys    Phe
Mutant 1:    Met    Ala    Val    Lys    Phe
Mutant 2:    Met    Ala    Asp    stop    
Mutant 3:    Met    Leu    Thr    Ser    Ser
Mutant 4:    Met    Cys    stop
You should report the following:
Original:    ATG    GCT    GAC    AAG    TTC    
Mutant 1:    ATG    GCT    GTC    AAG    TTC       missense  
Mutant 2:    ATG    GCT    GAC    TAG    TTC       nonsense  
Mutant 3:    ATG    CTG    ACA    AGT    TC        deletion
Mutant 4:    ATG    TGC    TGA    CAA    GTT    C  insertion
             ATG    GCC    GAC    AAG    TTC       silent
"
reviews.comment_teaching:
Jessica Tang: B-
your standard ppt. reader. She didn't even seem to know what was in her own ppt. though. Pretty boring, but it's biology after all.

Eugene Hung: A-
somehow managed to make biology interesting. Pretty friendly and passionate.

Both of them speak pretty slowly and gently, so you might need to sleep earlier the night before lectures.

How well they teach doesn't matter that much anyway since it's just pure memorization.
reviews.comment_grading:
highly recommend this course over other seng fundamental courses (provided you're good at memorization) and lifs/oces ssci foundation courses, especially lifs 1930 (science foundation only).

the effort you spend is directly proportional to your grade, although you might need to spend quite a bit of effort if again, you're not good at memorization.
A because it's better than other lifs/oces ssci foundation courses

Midterm (45%): 55/60, mean 42.9, SD 9.31
all MC, 1 hour (1min per)

Attendance (Tang) (5%): 5/5
iprs after add drop period, max one class missed without a valid reason (you only need to answer them, doesn't matter if you're correct or not)

Final (45%): 78/90 (no data)
all MC, 80 minutes (< 1min per)

Project (5%): 4/5
1 mark lost from using the missense sequence to create the silent one

Participation (Hung) (5%): 0/5
bonus mark for answering his questions during lectures, 0.5 for each answer (again, not necessarily correct, although it does have to be at least logical)

6 marks for every subgrade (except D-F)
dynamic absolute grading

A+: >=93
A: 87-92.75
A-: 81-86.75
B+: 75-80.75
B: 69-74.75
B-: 63-68.75
C+: 57-62.75
C: 51-56.75
C-:45-50.75
D: 33-44.75
F: <33

89.25 -> A
reviews.comment_workload:
there's like a lot less to memorize than in lifs 1902.

The project takes around an hour, and requires only googling the words "missense", "nonsense", "deletion", "insertion" and "silent", and logic. No biology involved. You can even complete it without attending any of the lectures/reading the notes.

you should have more than enough time in the midterm and final if you've studied.

skipped all the lectures (but one) after midterm, then watched them all 2 days before the final.

you should probably still attend all the lectures though since you can get a maximum of 10 points from that, and it helps you memorize the stuff anyway. Kinda regret skipping them.

reviews.comment_teaching:
如果你 *上堂前* 知道/清楚/認識/明白 果堂學嘅係咩，上他堂你就會跟得上，因爲：
1. 可能係本人英文唔好，成日聼唔明他講咩，睇zoom record同一句都要聼幾次先明
2. 他講野較悶，如果唔較大聲d，就會好似白噪音，忽略左一兩句就會唔明之後講咩
3. 他有時會跳ppt，唔跟次序，留意返
4. 他有時會播片，但係d片如果冇字幕同埋你對bio專業名詞唔熟悉，就准備之後自己睇返

另外，
1. 他有時會問問題，話係計participation分，問左之後，先係有幾個答，然後就一窩蜂猶如洗版，留意下
2. 他早期推薦左幾個 YT，例如Amoeba Sisters，值得執生時參考
3. 他有end of chapter question sets，十分值得做，有時會發現學到新野
4. 今年有specical topic，唔難

整體而言，他教得唔錯，只要你識得上網睇返唔明嘅地方或仔細睇多幾次份notes同recording（即肯學就能駕馭）

This is a nicely executed course :D

reviews.author: gakusei123
reviews.title: Interesting Course
reviews.comment_content:
The first half of the course is about basic Biology concepts, like molecules of life, eukaryotic and prokaryotic cells, molecules of life, cell membrane, enzymes, and glycolysis. The depth of content is slightly higher than high school stuff. However, I think glycolysis might have been a bit too difficult for everyone.

The second half is mainly about genetics, covering DNA transcription and translation, cell reproduction, and mutations. A special topic about viruses was taught and was also part of the exam syllabus. There was not enough time for the last topic which was about classifying different living organisms. This part was comparatively more challenging but was much more in-depth.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tang's teaching was fair. She usually reads out of the PowerPoint and sometimes gets lost in what she's talking about. The slides weren't prepared too well too - they often lack clear explanations, leaving us to search the answers online. What's worse is she counts participation points by the iLearn thing, and you'll lose 5% if you miss two lessons. (She also doesn't post the Zoom link publicly, and NIHK students email her to get the link (lol))

Hung was absolutely brilliant. He explains very clearly and is very patient and helpful when answering our questions. He has a set of slides provided to students for revision, and he also prepared another set of actively maintained slides for teaching. He sometimes makes animations for explaining processes like B and T cell activation and protein translation. He likes to talk about interesting extra content and ask  "why does something happen" questions, which I think is a good touch to make us focused and interested.
reviews.comment_grading:
I'm not sure for everyone, it's good I guess. It's a true absolute grading and I think you can find the scheme in other reviews (the course already got deleted from my Canvas :( ). The average is around B according to Hung.

Scheme:
(First Half)
  5% Participation
45% Mid-term (70Q, 1 Hour)
(Second Half)
50% Final (300 Marks, 2 Hours)
( 5% Bonus Marks if you participated in class)

I ended with an A+.
reviews.comment_workload:
Rather light. There are no assignments and only exams. However, there is quite a lot of stuff to memorize which may take you a bit of time.

Also
I hate getting up at 9:00 every Monday and Wednesday just to get those 5% participation marks
It's bad for my body
:(

reviews.comment_content: Totally blank it out...

reviews.comment_grading:
Really good grade.
midterm: 50%(45%+5%iPRS)
final: 50%(45%+5%bonus)

My grade:
midterm: 63/70 5/5
final: 230/300, no bonus
overall: 85%
I got A. I believe people can memorize all the slides as well as answering enough questions in HUNG's lecture will absolutely get a satisfactory grade. I've thought I would got A+ even without the bonus points but it is proved that 5 points is much more important than I thought.
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment.

reviews.author: Soku
reviews.title: A course where efforts can pay off ( Memorization with a bit of understanding needed )
reviews.comment_content:
Focuses on the basics.
Dr. Tang's part talks about stuff like what cells are made off, how respiration works. Mostly memorization for the mid-term.
Dr. Hung's part talks about stuff like DNA replication, cell division. Still memorization but requires more understanding.

It's not difficult to get A range if you try a bit, since the questions in exams are straight-forward mostly.

Syllabus:
Dr. Tang's part:
[Organization of Life]
The study of life
The Chemical Basis of Life/The Molecules of Life
Cell Structure and Function
Biological membranes: Structure and Function
[Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms]
Energy and Enzymes
Respiration
MID TERM EXAM

Dr. Hung's part:
[Continuity of Life]
Determination of Form & Function of an Organism
[Special topic]
Viruses, Immune Responses & Vaccines
Making of a New Life
[Biodiversity]
Differences among Living Individuals
FINAL EXAM
reviews.comment_teaching: I skipped 95% of lectures so I can't give much info here. They speak clear enough and the lecture notes are good enough. I could catch up by reading the notes and learning online.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-term: 45% (70 MC)
Clicker questions: 5%
Finals: 50% ( 40 MC, 40 true-false type questions, some short answer questions )
If you answer Dr. Hung's questions in class enough times ( not sure how many ), you can get a maximum bonus of 5%.

ABSOLUTE GRADING, nothing to complain about.
90 or above: A+
85-89.99: A
and so on...
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignments, no quizzes.

REMEMBER TO ATTEND DR. TANG'S LECTURES AT LEAST.
THERE ARE CLICKER QUESTIONS THAT ARE GRADED 5%. It doesn't matter if you get them wrong.

Advice:
Try your best to get a good score in the mid-terms, since it's more basic, memorization-based and straight-forward. And since it counts for 50%, it helps if you do a bit worse in the finals.

reviews.author: fairy saint
reviews.title: good grade class
reviews.comment_content:

If you are an AP or  IB student, the exam style is quite different from the exercise that you have done. Overall, easy to learn but very annoying.
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, both professors are quite nice guys though they don't teach that well. Maybe since its content is very simple, the class goes in PPT-reading style. Prof.Tang likes laughing and jokes, but we couldn't get her points. Prof.Hung would involve more Q&A but sometimes he couldn't make himself understood for his speaking too fast and accent.
reviews.comment_grading:
absolute grading system every term according to Prof.Hung
A+ (>= 90.00), A (85.00-89.99), A- (80.00-84.99), B+ (75.00-79.99), B (70.00-74.99), B- (65.00-69.99), C+ (60.00-64.99), C (55.00-59.99), C- (50.00-54.99), D (40.00-49.99), F (<40.00)

But Prof.Hung said he would add a project to this spring term.

reviews.author: anyeongg
reviews.title: Grade booster if you have basic biology background
reviews.comment_content:
Content covers mostly about characteristics of living organisms, cell structures, DNA and reproduction and biodiversity

Part I and II were taught by Jessica and Part III and IV were taught by Eugene Hung

This semester professor Eugene Hung added a special topic (included in final): Viruses, Immune Responses & Vaccines for us to understand the science behind Covid-19 virus.

Lecture contents (Jessica)
1. Study of life
2. The chemical basis of life
3. The molecules of life
4.  Cell structure and function
5. Biological membranes
6. Energy and enzymes
7. Cellular respiration

Lecture contents (Eugene)
8. Determination of form and function of an organism
Special topic: viruses, immune responses and vaccines
9. Making of a new life
10. Differences among living individuals
11. Variety of living things on earth
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both professors upload powerpoint presentation on canvas, which is different depending on professors.

Jessica’s powerpoint is messy and unorganized, with subtopics not arranged in a good order. Need more resources from the internet. Furthermore, she just teaches by reading the powerpoint slides without explaining in detail. More like a student doing his first powerpoint presentation.

Eugene’s powerpoint slides are good, explaining much of the details. However, it is better for you to watch his recordings as he explains in greater detail and his presented powerpoints are updated with more information. Eugene’s teaching is decent, but his voice is very soft and makes you asleep.

Besides, for Fall 2021, both lectures are 9am - 10.20am lectures on monday and wednesday morning, so i rarely attend them and end up left behind.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading should be absolute, but professors have not give any info regarding this.

For Jessica’s lectures there are clicker questions (also known as IPRS questions) that represent 5% of the total grade.

IPRS (up to the end of Jessica’s lessons): 5%
Midterm exam: 45%
Final exam: 50%
reviews.comment_workload: Barely any workload. The only workload is to catch up with the lectures are remember this as an actual 3 credit course. Not putting effort will result in you being lost and having so much to catch up, which is what happened to me when preparing for the midterm exam.

reviews.author: wkwkwkkwkw
reviews.title: Yeet
reviews.comment_content:
Chp 1: The Study of Life
Chp 2: The Chemical Basis of Life
Chp 3: The Molecules of Life
Chp 4: Cell Structure and Function
Chp 5: Biological Membranes: Structure and Function
Chp 6: Energy and Enzymes
Chp 7: Respiration
Chp 8: Determination of Form and Function of an Organism
Chp 9: Making of a New Life
Special Topic: Viruses, Immune Responses and Vaccines
Chp 10: Differences among Living Individuals
Chp 11: Variety of Living Things on Earth (Not enough time to cover)

I would say the content is decent. Some chapters were VERY interesting but most of them were sleep inducing.

Dr. Tang's part was easy (Chapter 1-7). You just need to memorise from her powerpoint slides and you should be good to go.

Dr Hung's part was difficult for me (Chapter 8-10). These chapters require you to understand the concepts being taught rather than just memorising. I strongly recommend future students to pay attention to Dr. Hung's lectures as he will expand on the powerpoint slides in these lectures.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr. Tang reads from the powerpoint but that by no means makes her a bad professor. She gives detailed notes in the powerpoint that will sufficiently prepare you for the midterms, provided you put in effort to read through them. She has quite a cheery voice and is a very nice and approachable person.

Dr. Hung is a very good professor. His powerpoint slides are neatly organized and easy to understand. His teaching is also very good, he clearly has the passion to teach. His voice is quite soft though and the lectures are held at 9 am. These two factors combined = You will feel sleepy. Dr. Hung also provided us with question sets for each chapter. Try to do these questions sets as the difficulty of the questions are very similar to that of the finals.

Overall, I would say both instructors did a decent job in teaching us the course materials. Dr. Hung was definitely better though.
reviews.comment_grading:
45% Midterm (Chapter 1-7)
5% iPRS (only for Dr. Tang’s part)
50% Finals (Chapter 8-10 (with special topic))
Absolute grading

Grading range:
A+ (>= 90.00), A (85.00-89.99), A- (80.00-84.99), B+ (75.00-79.99), B (70.00-74.99), B- (65.00-69.99), C+ (60.00-64.99), C (55.00-59.99), C- (50.00-54.99), D (40.00-49.99), F (<40.00)


Midterms:
Format: 70 MCQ
My Grade: 65/70 (Mean: 53.1/70)
SD: 9.3
Nothing hard, just memorise and understand from powerpoint. Dr. Tang's questions are straightforward.

iPRS:
My Grade: 100
Just attend Dr. Tang's lectures and click random choices in the iPRS sessions. She will be sure to give you full mark if you don't miss more than 2 of these iPRS sessions.

Finals:
Format: 40 MCQ (2 marks each), 40 multiple T/F Questions (4 marks each. -1 for every wrong answer) and 3 open ended questions (60 marks).
My Grade: 218/300
The finals were pretty difficult. The MCQ and open ended sections were simple enough to do. The multiple true or false questions, however, was crazy (I'm pretty sure I lost majority of marks there).

My total grade for this course: 83.1.
Letter Grade: A-.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light. All you have to do is join Dr. Tang’s lectures to get the participation marks from her iPRS questions (even if you get wrong, she’ll still give you full marks).

As for Dr. Hung, he doesn’t require you to attend lectures but he will give extra credits to those who are participative in class. You should probably do these extra credit activities, you never know (it could save your ass from getting a bad grade).

reviews.author: Eliza
reviews.comment_content:
Tang's part:
ch1 the study of life
ch2 the chemical basis of life
ch3 the molecules of life
ch4 cell structure and function
ch5 plasma membrane
ch6 energy and enzymes
ch7 cellular respiration

Hung's part:

s. viruses immune responses and vaccines

It is really an introductory class for Biology. I did not take biology in high school, but it is still not too hard for me to understand and memorize everything

Dr Tang reads the PPT a lot, but she's cute. Feel like she has the passion to teach but its 早九 so you know....

For Dr Hung's part, i cannot say much cuz without the compulsory iprs attendance, i didnt go to class anymore. I would say if you do not want the bonus points, it would be unnecessary to get up so early for the class. I read the book and the PPT and eventually get A range without bonus points.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading
grading scheme:
A+ (>= 90.00), A (85.00-89.99), A- (80.00-84.99), B+ (75.00-79.99), B (70.00-74.99), B- (65.00-69.99), C+ (60.00-64.99), C (55.00-59.99), C- (50.00-54.99), D (40.00-49.99), F (<40.00)

for Tang's part:
5% iprs attendance mark
45% midterm - MCQs
mean is 53.1/70 and SD is 9.3

for Hung's part:
50% final
bonus pts up to 5 pts
mean and SD are not released

the iprs part is easy to get, as long as you choose one answer for every clicker question, you will get the mark.
The midterm is MCQs that you can do well as long as you memorize everything from the PPT. In total 70 marks and time limit is 1 hour.
***marks will be deducted if you got the question wrong***

final
the final paper consists of three parts and in total 300 marks and two hours
1. MCQs - i think there are about 40 of them, each worths 2 marks. no marks will be deducted for wrong answers.
2. T/F questions - around 20 i think? i cant quite remember. each question will have four branches for you to answer whether it is correct or wrong, each branch worths 1 mark.  
***marks will be deducted for wrong answer in this part*** so you d better leave any question not sure blank...
3. written questions - this part is quite easy. each one of them covers one topic.
reviews.comment_workload:
No Homework at all, as long as you memorize the PPT.
Probably reading the corresponding chapters in Campbell Biology can help you understand better.

The bonus point scheme is kinda stressful cuz i want to get the bonus but i hate answering questions or asking questions...

reviews.author: japholic
reviews.title: Quite good （What you reap, what you sow.）
reviews.comment_content:
[Copied from the previous review]
Part I: Organization of Life:
-The study of life
-The Chemical Basis of Life/The Molecules of Life
-Cell Structure and Function
-Biological membranes: Structure and Function

Part II: Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms:

**Midterm examination (Parts I & II)

reviews.comment_teaching:
Both of them are passionate about teaching, so don't hesitate to ask them questions if you have enquiries. They will answer you timely and seriously.

[Both of them just read from the ppt but sometimes they may add extra things verbally]
Professor Tang required attendance due to IPRS, her lecture is quite funny and lively so it's hard to fall asleep XD

The voice and volume of Professor Hung are a bit soft, so you need to pay some effort in order to stay awake XDD. And he would to teach something extra so as to enrich our knowledge, which I found this interesting.
reviews.comment_grading:
I didn't study biology in high school. The part before midterm is relatively straightforward (but easy to make silly mistakes if you aren't careful enough).

Midterm (45%): closed-book exam, all are MCs (70 MCQs)
**Marks will be deducted for the wrong answer
**Choose the most accurate answer ;-)
Average: 51.7/70 [Me: 60/70]
SD: 10.4
Participation mark (IPRS): 5% (just answer all the mc during the lesson, you still get marks even your answer is wrong) [Me: 5/5]

The final exam is opened-book, all MCs as well
**Marks won't be deducted for the wrong answer
Quite challenging QQ I had 3 questions left unattempted
The professor didn't reveal the mean/ SD.
Final exam (45%) my score: 48/70
Project (5%) my score: 4.75/5

Overall I got A- (there is absolute grading)
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light. There is almost nothing to hand in but except the individual project.

For the individual project, the workload is fair. This time we are asked to compare the DNA sequence between the covid-19 and its mutants and write a brief explanation base on your own knowledge. (Professor Hung said you will get marks if your explanation is reasonable and logical.) I think it's not difficult, what you need to do is just follow all the instruction given by the professor and you will be fine. Detail instruction will be given.

Professor Hung gave some online MCQs practice via CANVAS, and I think it is worthy to do it once before the exam as some of the questions will be repeated again during the final exam ;-)

reviews.author: Ctong
reviews.comment_content:
Part I: Organization of Life:

The study of life
The Chemical Basis of Life/The Molecules of Life
Cell Structure and Function
Biological membranes: Structure and Function

Part II: Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms:

Energy and Enzymes
Respiration/ revision class

Mid- term examination (Parts I & II)

Part III: Continuity of Life:

Determination of Form & Function of an Organism
Making of a New Life

Part IV: Biodiversity:

Differences among Living Individuals
Variety of Living Things on Earth

Final examination (Parts III & IV)

The part before midterm is relatively easy if you touch a little bit biology in high school. However, the part after midterm talks about genetics and I think it is relatively hard for student without biology  background.
For exam, Jessica's midterm is relatively easy. Although it is closed-book, all are MCs and they are quite straightforward.
However, the final is a different format from previous year. Instead of MCs ,True-False and short questions in past paper, the final is a new format. I think it is a kind of case study with all short questions. Although it is opened-book, it is quite challenging.
reviews.comment_teaching:
There are 2 instructors in this course.

Before midterm, it is Jessica teaching. Jessica's teaching is interesting. Before the lecture and during break, she would play music to help us relax. She tries to include some jokes in her presentation and this make the lecture more interesting. However, this course is at 9am and there are clicker questions (IPRS). Also, there are no lecture videos provided(except in add-drop period). These force you to attend her lecture and you may feel very tired if you cannot get up early.

After midterm, it is Eugene Hung teaching. He is kind to provide you with lecture videos and there is no IPRS, which is good if you really hate 9am class.
However, he gives bonus marks to those students answering or asking him questions. If you want to have high marks, please try to attend his lectures as many as you can. Nevertheless, his tone is a little bit boring. It is easy for you to sleep as it is a 9am course. In general, he teaches well and is willing to answer questions.

Normal content

1. Part I - Organization of Life
The study of life
The Chemical Basis of Life/The Molecules of Life
Cell Structure and Function
Biological membranes: Structure and Function

2. Part II - Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms
Energy and Enzymes
Respiration, Photosynthesis

3. Part III - Continuity of Life/DNA the blueprint of life
Patterns of inheritance
The cellular basis of reproduction and inheritance
Molecular biology of the gene
How genes are controlled
DNA Technology and Genomics
Evolution and speciation
reviews.comment_teaching:
Quite boring. Easy to fall asleep. Delivery of content is quite bad. However, the processor has lots of knowledge.
So if you do not understand you need to ask questions personally or rely on yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:
Mid-Term Exam: 45%

Final Exam: 45%

clicker questions during the class: 10%

normally there are 3 questions for every class. These questions start after add/drop period until the final examination.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload is very light. There are only a few assignments. Assignments are easy and it will not stress you. However, if the class is boring and difficult to understand, you must work hard to get good grades by your own work.

reviews.author: agtao
reviews.comment_content:
Part I: Organization of Life
The study of life
The Chemical Basis of Life/The Molecules of Life
Cell Structure and Function
Biological membranes: Structure and Function

Part II: Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms
Energy and Enzymes
Respiration, Photosynthesis

Part III: Continuity of Life/DNA the blueprint of life
Patterns of inheritance
The cellular basis of reproduction and inheritance
Molecular biology of the gene
How genes are controlled
DNA Technology and genomics
Evolution and speciation

Part I and part II are just about memorizing powerpoint slides. Part III requires more time as u need to understand some important concepts like the different  DNA technologies, as well as how inheritance work etc....
reviews.comment_teaching: I personally found it boring.The teaching only consists of reading the slides. Part I and Part II are taught by prof Tang which is boring but every information you need to know in the exams are on her slides. Part III is taught by prof Tye, her teaching is slightly less boring than prof Tang but her slides are basically 30% of what you are supposed to know in exams. You need to do research with her slides as they provide very superficial understanding of each topic/concept.
reviews.comment_grading:
If u are good at memorizing then u will get good grades.
Didn't listen to any of the lectures and still got A by only memorizing the slides and doing some research to understand some concepts.
reviews.comment_workload: No additional work at home. Just in class clicker questions.

reviews.author: kishore
reviews.title: Take it only if you absolutely need it.
reviews.comment_content: If you have done IB, it is a mix of HL and SL IB. Before mid term you do mainly animal cells and plant cells. After mid terms you do DNA, cell replication and some biotechnology and evolution. The content is not cumulative, so whatever is testes in mid term won't come for final.
reviews.comment_teaching: Very bad, and very boring. The worse is there is PRS quiz which counts to 10% of your grade so you can't skip and lectures. Tang slides were good, but tye slides were horrible. I would recommend watching online videos and online lectures as they were more useful for me then anything I did in the lecture. Take some sort of entertainment in the lecture so you don't get bored.
reviews.comment_grading: Mid term was 45% Final was 45%, PRS quiz was 10%. PI got somewhere in between 7 and 8% for PRS. Mid term got 1 sd above mean. Final scores weren't given. Overall I got a b+.
reviews.comment_workload: No work load as there no HW. Just need to study the content. Depending on how good you are with memorisation, iw should take you a week to study all the content.

reviews.author: Ah Lam
reviews.title: Basic Biology Class
reviews.comment_content: Basic biology knowledge, covering the syllabus of HKDSE Biology.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Miss Tang has a relatively flat intonation, which made me feel sleepy all the time, so the lesson could be quite boring and the delivery of the biology knowledge was room for improvement.
Miss Tye has a better intonation. But still, sometimes she didn't give adequate concise explanation during teaching.
reviews.comment_grading:
I didn't study much in the mid-term and the score of mid-term exam is below mean.
I studied 70% of the syllabus for the final exam and got a B- at the end.
The exams are only consisted of multiple choice questions, so won't be too difficult. But if you didn't study Chemistry at secondary school or high school, it could be very tough for you to follow the content.
reviews.comment_workload:
You just need to study hard for the exams.
You have to do some preparation if you want to get a high marks in the clicker questions part which will be  counted 10% for the final grades.

reviews.comment_teaching:
Boring.
Can't understand what they are teaching.
You have to rely on yourself.
reviews.comment_grading:

reviews.comment_workload: Although there are no assignment, you have to learn much knowledge of biology in a short time.

reviews.author: funnysam
reviews.comment_content:
Basic characteristics of the cell, photosynthesis and cellular respiration, cell division, DNA, Variety of life, the evolution of life... etc.

The content is various and kind of interesting, especially for the DNA part. And all the content are understandable. Lecture video is uploaded. Just watching them repeatedly can help you get a good grade.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor HUNG is VERY GOOD.

He is willing to answer any question. And even you ask him in the e-mail, he will explain in detail. Besides, he is willing to see the contribution in this course, so BOUNS MARK is given to those who ask meaningful questions, and who contribute to the online discussion.

He explains every part thoroughly, which makes us easily to understand(memorize) the content.
reviews.comment_grading:
VERY GOOD GRADE, Absolute Grading

Mid-term 30%
Final 60%
Individual Project 10%

Officially:
A+ >=90
A   >=85
... and so on. 5 marks =1 subgrade
40<=D<50
F<40

But it depends:
If HUNG thinks that the exams are too hard (the mean is low), he will consider lowering the grading scale.

For myself, since the mean in mid-term is too low, he decided to lower it becoming:
A+ >=85
A   >=80
... and so on. Still 5 marks =1 subgrade
28<=D<45
F<28

For the individual Project, it is very easy. You can finish it within a few hours. HUNG will also teach you how to do it in detail during the lecture. MUST GET MARK (10%)
reviews.comment_workload:
VERY LIGHT.

The only assignment is the individual project, which is very easy, taking you merely a few hours. Better keep revising the lecture note or the lecture video weekly.

If you want to watch all the lecture videos just before the exams, you will panic, since the content is a little bit broad (even it is easy to understand). Trust me, that's not a good idea.

reviews.author: Minerva
reviews.comment_content:
- The study of life
- The chemical basis of life
- The molecules of life
- Cell structure and function
- Biological membranes
- Energy and enzymes

A lot of things to memorize, but acceptable
reviews.comment_teaching: Dr. Tang has a unique accent, so sometimes it is hard to understand what she's saying. Prof. Tye is good at English, but her teaching is a bit boring. Actually there is no reason to go to the lecture (except for the clicker questions) because you can catch up with everything if you read the textbook and lecture notes.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 45%
Final 45%
In-class clicker questions 10%

No attendance, but there are in-class clicker questions, so attending almost every lecture is required. If you answer 80% of the total questions correctly, then you will get the full mark.

I got 97.1/200 for midterm and full mark for clicker questions. (final exam result not announced) Finally A+
reviews.comment_workload: No hw or assignment, but you definitely need to spend much time on studying for midterm and final in order to memorize everything you learn.

reviews.author: sentiment.zero
reviews.comment_content: Content is not that hard to understand. It is available to study without attending lecture, only with books. However, it may take some time until fully understanding it and memorising the contents well for exam.
reviews.comment_grading: Able to have good grade without attending lecture. Got 1-2 SD at mid term, and do not know score of final exam, but got A- as result. (Full marked at IPRS)
reviews.comment_workload: No assignment at all. But have IPRS quizzes about 3-4 question per lecture. Should get 80% correct answers for total iprs quiz to get the full score.

reviews.author: Jet
reviews.title: Broad content
reviews.comment_content: A lot of things are covered in this course. Not so hard to understand and catch up the class if you read textbook. It gets hard and really need to revise with the textbook when you start learning DNA technology.
reviews.comment_teaching: The professor is really nice but couldn't handle the crowds making noise. All the things the professor teaches are from the textbook.
reviews.comment_grading: There is clicker questions every lecture and midterm and final exams. Clicker questions are simple if you listen to the lecture. The exams are in MCQs, but since a lot of contents are covered better read the textbook several times. The more you read the textbook the easier the exam becomes.
reviews.comment_workload: No work, but need to read the textbook to catch up the class and for the exams.

reviews.author: MEMENTO
reviews.comment_content: The content was very broad and we had to learn in detail for each topic. The content includes classification of organisms, cells and structures, chemistry of nutrients, mitosis and meiosis, evolution, etc.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Tang and professor Bik Tye had very different lecturing style. Professor Tang was very generous for those students who were chatting during the lecture, but professor Bik Tye did not allow students to chat each other during her lecture at all. Their lecture notes (PPT and PDF) were very helpful in understanding the lecture.
reviews.comment_grading:
Grading was as follows:
45% for mid term and final each
10% for clicker question (online quiz during the lecture)
for clicker question, one can lose upto 15% to get full marks.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload was only about reading the chapters from the book corresponding to the lecture. However, the reading takes a lot of time, simply because there is a lot to read.

reviews.author: jparkar
reviews.comment_content:
Learn basic knowledge of biology.
Covers AS content in GCE/IAL and IB SL Biology so it is good to have background knowledge of them. It might be difficult if you didn't study biology for a long time.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Professor Jessica had relatively appropriate lecture notes compared to Professor Bik.
Not enough information presented in the lecture notes so a lot of self-study required. The textbook has enough information to cover mid-term and final exam.
reviews.comment_grading: All the questions in the mid-term and final exam were in MCQ format. Quite easy if you have studied all the chapters thoroughly.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light.
Daily revision is required because there are 2-4 clicker questions in every lecture.
It would be hard to cover all the chapters in a few days so I recommend studying regularly.

reviews.comment_grading:
Mid term 45%
Final exam 45%
Clicker 10%
All are in MC format

No assignment, quiz, project
Attendance will be recorded by iPRS every lecture. You can tell your friend to send the access code if you do not want to attend the lecture.
It is advisable to go through the powerpoints after every lecture or you would not know how to answer the iPRS.

reviews.author: htjy0223
reviews.title: 真係好伏！
reviews.comment_content: 大伏！Add drop之前仲係好簡單，會等你唔想drop，完左add drop就收皮喇！Jessica果part都係圍繞著cellular respiration同ATP，好多都係DSE Level，TYE係mid term之後先教，佢就係全部都圍繞著DNA、DNA technology同evolution，我覺得難好多！final同mid term都係全MC，不過好CHUR，差唔多1分鐘1條。mid term係70分鐘70題；final就90分鐘82題
reviews.comment_teaching: Jessica同TYE都會落堂後用好多時間去答學生唔明既地方，不過TYE會好著重課堂紀律，一有人嘈佢就會即刻停同會罵D學生。
reviews.comment_grading: midterm below mean ~0.3 SD, final 冇stat(應該都係below)，最尾C+
reviews.comment_workload:
mid term 45%
final 45%
IPRS 10%
唔駛旨意走堂，因為堂堂一定有IPRS，仲要每堂3條，通常都係lecture既頭中尾先有，所以叫做完3條IPRS就可以走先！jessica出既題目比較易，就算冇睇NOTES，都可以上網search，TYE果D就真係考D學生有冇上堂聽書，所以通常都唔可以每堂都答岩D IPRS問題。冇assignment同Quiz！

reviews.author: hongchitloo
reviews.comment_content: It is not a difficult course but you have to remember a lot of things.
reviews.comment_teaching: Two professors are there, Herrup is the better one and I like his lesson more.
reviews.comment_grading:
I am below mean in the mid term for about 5 points , mean is about 70% in mid term
I got 80% in final exam and I didn't know the mean score.
Finally I got a B.
reviews.comment_workload: There is no assignment, the only thing about this course are mid term and final exam. You have to revise for about 2 days to get a good grade in each of them.

reviews.author: nonane
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to DSE biology, but some of contents are more difficult. As a introductory course, it is very difficult for those did not learn biology before. The content:
cell structure,respiration,genetics,evolution and so on.
reviews.comment_teaching:
The professors make the lesson boring. I think they expect the students have taken biology before, so they taught really fast.
Fortunately, the ppt are quite well-organised although it is not enough to just study them and go to exam.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading seems not bad, but if you hate biology, don't take this course!! Your grade will be very bad. The course is not as easy as you think.
My midterm is above mean about 0.8sd and got B+ finally.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework, just iPRS. But if you want to attain higher marks in exam, you had better to do some exercises ,since the exam is quite difficult and not all the materials can be found in ppt.

reviews.author: 2042XXXX
reviews.title: Just don't choose this course unless you want LIFS major
reviews.comment_content: The course is split between 2 profs, and clicker questions will be asked in EVERY lecture. despite only counting 85% of the clicker questions, not much students can get full score from that.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Prof Tang teaching was quite boring. Her explanation was quite difficult to understand and always makes broken gag all the time. Not an enjoyable lecture.
Prof. Tye was passion about teaching, and at least she tried to give us interesting video, which I still don't like but if you are interested in biology then you will get into it. Nevertheless the content and explanation of Prof Tye was rich.
reviews.comment_grading:
I suggested to work as hard as you would in final during mid-term in this course because both exam make up equal proportion of marks (40%)
The rest 10% is from 85% of the clicker questions.
Grading was fine. Minimal understanding will make you a D if your aim is just to pass this course, and higher grade is achievable by investing time in it.
reviews.comment_workload: Workload was hard because the exam is dependent on the book, which I believe no much students would bother to buy 2 books for one course and most likely to not major LIFS as most of the students choosing this course has never studied biology. Workload was intense despite the lack of assignment, and I spent one week preparing this particular final but still can't get it done. There are too much information to remember.

reviews.author: Ayush (om)
reviews.title: Fine enough if you are interested/have the ability to learn
reviews.comment_content:
Similar to 11th and 12th grade biology. Actually this course partially covers Lessons 1 to 15 of the Pearson Life Science book, divided into 3 parts:
1. Organization of Life
2.Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms &
3. Continuity of Life/DNA the blueprint of life

It is said to read the book along with the lectures. (they make us purchase ebook, sharing is best, 328 HKD per ebook, just share)

I just used the end of chapter review sections, because I am not much keen to learn Life Science, but I have some interest in understanding and appreciating it.
(No online assignments, use of ebook is just to read the book, it also provides extra questions to practice which are sometimes nice, I didn't used them)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Difficult to comment, Both Professors try to create some interest, but it seemed (to me) that they have assumed that we are going to take LIFS as our major. So I attended all the lectures (otherwise it is difficult to catch up, as I am not a easy to learn without understanding well type person).
For me teaching was fine enough (by both Professors).
reviews.comment_grading:
Fine enough. I did't prepared much beyond lectures, finally got a B+ (was in upper quartile in mid terms, forgot finals score, probably almost same percentile).
My friends also solved/learned book's questions as well as ebook's extra questions (which they think came directly into exams, I don't know/think so).
Some people just read book, solve questions and do not revise lecture notes.
My view: If you are good in learning and just expect B+ or lesser, you might not need to study chapters from book (often out of syllabus, and generally Professors cover the important part already in lecture notes). Practice, Review is good to do.
Otherwise book is good.
Depends on abilities.
reviews.comment_workload:
Nothing except iPRS, 10% towards after adjustment (multiplying factor, easy to get full even when only 80% correct).
(Attendance not counted directly, but in form of iPRS questions answered correctly, you can't answer when you aren't in class).

reviews.author: sroh
reviews.comment_content:
Quite easy even for those with no bio backgrounds.

Contens :Chemistry of living things, Cell theory, Energy and cellular respiration, Mitosis, Meiosis, Classification of living things
reviews.comment_teaching: I didn't usually attend the lectures but was able to catch up with all the contents as all the lecture videos were uploaded on the Canvas.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light.
Mainly memorization and a little bit of understanding are required for exams.
No other quizes or tests in this course.

reviews.author: Eclipse
reviews.title: OK ish course
reviews.comment_content:
Pretty standard stuff that you would think someone doing biology would definitely know. Areas such as:

- Chemistry of living things
- Cell theory
- Energy and cellular respiration
- Mitosis
- Meiosis
- Classification of living things

are all covered in this course. If you have done biology at secondary school level or high school level, these topics should sound pretty familiar to you. In terms of content wise, this course is actually pretty decent.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Teaching is decent for Prof Hung. He knows what he is teaching and he tries to make sure that he explains things in a manner which it is pretty understandable. If not for the fact that the lectures were in the morning, he should have a lot more students attending his class.

Prof Wong definitely knows his things, but he likes to bring in things that don't really have much relation to what we learn, and it kinda makes people not want to listen to him since it's hard to discern what is useful from what he says. Also, the fact that the examination set by this professor is almost identical to the questions from the textbook, which makes listening and learning in his class pretty much useless.
reviews.comment_grading:
Absolute grading for this semester:

A+ (>= 90)
A (85-89.75)
A- (80-84.75)
B+ (75-79.75)
B (70-74.75)
B- (65-69.75)
C+ (60-64.75)
C (55-54.75)
C- (50-54.75)
D (40-49.75)
F (<40)

With the mean of 61, and a standard deviation of 14, the class average is at C+. It would be better off taking another course if you are taking this course for the fact that it is a common core, because it is not that easy to score very very well in this course.

For your info,

Midterm - 46/50, mean 40, SD 6
Final - 39/50, mean 21.33, SD 9.71
Overall - 85/100, mean 61.17, SD 13.84
I got an A.
reviews.comment_workload:
Basically nothing to do other than to study for the papers.
There is a small project in some semesters, but that too isn't very difficult to complete since it is only a 2-3 page report.

reviews.author: bugdanding
reviews.title: LIFS1901
reviews.comment_content: midterm前可以完全唔上堂唔睇video，靠睇textbook加做textbook練習就得(midterm有9成題目出書）。midterm後就建議上堂或睇video，會易明好多，而且final會難好多（mean 20/50)。
reviews.comment_teaching:
midterm前果個教得好_悶
midterm 後果個好好多，而且你又唔明email問佢佢都會好詳細咁回答（我無問過，聽人講）
reviews.comment_grading:
50% midterm (50題MC）
50% final     （50題MC）
2%   bonus    (midterm後上堂答問題）
absolute grading
70-74.75 B
75-79.45 B+
80-84.75 A－
85-89.45 A
90-100    A＋
reviews.comment_workload: 得midterm final,堂唔上都得，workload真係唔大，肯溫書要B range唔難，不過要A range就真係幾難，80%先有但個final好難，個total course mean score都係得60分

reviews.author: ROK_Geoffrey
reviews.comment_content: Teaches various fundamental life science, particularly focusing on molecular biology part. Complies with 1000-level course difficulty, not so challenging, but those who have little basis on biology may find the course content cumbersome.
reviews.comment_teaching:
It's true that 9am courses are often physically demanding and LTA is the worst place to pay attention to the lecturer. Still, I felt extremely bored during the courses of both professors, cant help marking C for the section.
Happened to learn some biology before the semester, so I'm not so sure how effective teaching styles of lecturers were to biology-newbies.
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm 45%, Final 50%, Small research work 5%
Scoring better during the test directly means better grades.
I can't assure that the difficulty trend of tests would persist in future semesters, but I'll just write what I experienced.
During 15-16 fall semester, midterm was unexpectedly easy; this is not a personal deviation. Every friend of mine who was taking the course complained that the test was way too easy. Mean : 41~42/50
In the final, however, the difficulty skyrocketed. Questions required students to think much more deeply, and, most of all, over half of the MC questions were told to potentially have multiple answers. The outcome? Mean : 18~19/45
Even if your midterm meant to be super-easy, never be relaxed, study thoroughly to prepare for the possible backlash at the end of the term.
So far as I know, no worries for the 5% project. Marking might be more finicky than you'd predict, but it does not require creativity or make you spend more than 2 hours.

Grade obtained : A+
40% - Studied biology already intensively during high school
60% - Anticipated difficulty change and sincerely prepared for final
reviews.comment_workload:
Except for the 5% research project, which is not a big deal at all, you don't need to do anything outside lecture room.
Nonetheless, if you're a deadline fighter, you might be overwhelmed by the amount of details, for biology is usually that kinda stuff.
If you already have good habit of studying continually and gradually, workload would never be a problem for this course.

reviews.author: PokornyPetr
reviews.comment_content: Lot of Chemistry contained, very easy if you have chemistry background, especially prior to the midterm. After mid-term there is more biology and you will need to memorize few things, however if you did some biology in high school you will know most of them (DNA, Transcription, Translation etc.)
reviews.comment_teaching: Teaching is OK but little bit boring, presentations are posted online and lecture videos also. The teacher will also recommend a a book, which I recommend to get. The questions for midterm exams were mostly taken from the book.
reviews.comment_grading: Grading is a kind of average, being above average in mid-term and average in final got me B+ ( the grade is distributed as: 50%midterm,45% final,5% assignment). No attendance and homework (Except assignment, just before finals) are required.
reviews.comment_workload: There is only one assignment about evolution and DNA similarities between species, in some online application just before the final, which accounts for 5%, it was not very interesting thing to do, but it was not difficult either.

reviews.author: Caroling
reviews.comment_content:
內容唔複雜都唔會好多
每個ppt都二十幾頁左右
exam之前認真背就ok
reviews.comment_teaching:
WONG基本上就係讀ppt，而且答問題都唔系好耐心，一落課就走
HUNG人比較nice，雖然出題難d，但係可以學到好多野，真喺想學野就多去lecture，而且email問問題都答得好詳細
reviews.comment_grading:
好grade
mid-term比較簡單，題目基本上都係textbook個d習題，比重又唔小，所以要仔細d拿高分
final會比較難，考之前要注重細節地方
reviews.comment_workload: workload唔大，ppt唔算好多內容，有個individual project好容易做無咩技術含量，比重又唔大，求其做下search下就ok

reviews.author: girapkim
reviews.title: Ok
reviews.comment_content:
Basic theories of Life science
It says that you don't need any background knowledge
with biology, but it is recommended to have some as the class goes quite fast.
But it is boring such as most of the life science course
reviews.comment_teaching:
I would give C for Raymond WUNG and B for Eugene HUNG, but don't want to give B, so C.

WUNG just repeats what is on the text book. He follows exactly the flow of textbook. His way of explaining is very boring and very often he talks about issues not related with the syllabus. Absolutely no need to attend his lecture, nor look at his slide if you have the text book.

HUNG was better than WUNG. He does follow the textbook but he skips a lot of things in the textbook so I do not recommend to study the final with the textbook. His slide is also quite well made. But boring in general.
reviews.comment_grading:
I think that the grading was fair.
Everyone got what they deserved.
Midterm was very, very easy.
Final was quite tricky with multiple answer MCQ
but still doable
reviews.comment_workload: There is no workload except an individual project that HUNG gave us at the end of the semester, which took around one hour. One midterm and one final, that is it

reviews.author: Preston
reviews.title: Good Instructor good grade
reviews.comment_content:
Mid-term: DSE syllabus + limited extra information
Final: Simple and basic concepts as well as processes of genetics.
reviews.comment_teaching: Professor Hung's teaching is really very good. You will regret not to attend his lessons. He teaches for final for my semester.
reviews.comment_grading: I was above mean 0.5-1 SD for both mid-term and final. I still got an A for my total score.
reviews.comment_workload: Not much. There is a so-called individual project for the final exam. Yet, it could be finished in 30 minutes by following the sample and guidelines given by professor Hung.

reviews.author: Eggtart
reviews.comment_content:
Mid term前大多都係背吓structure,
Mid term後講gene, ecosystem會冇咁悶
reviews.comment_teaching:
上堂好易訓著:p
但留心聽都幾易明，
Eugene Hung好nice，落堂問佢野會答得好詳細：)
reviews.comment_grading: 靚grade,上堂明佢講乜+考前幾日背吓就ok
reviews.comment_workload: 得考試同一個individual project，基本上冇乜workload~個individual project快嘅1日可以做完(我用咗3日)

reviews.author: Colas
reviews.comment_content: General content of Biology for students without Biology background. Including chemical basis of life, cell structure and function, cellular respiration, genes and its variations. Biodiversity and ecology will also be included by the end of the course.
reviews.comment_teaching: I would say Prof Eugene Wong's teaching is excellent and Prof Raymond Wong's teaching is alright.
reviews.comment_grading: Exams are all MC so grading is straightforward. Questions are not too tricky. No attendance is taken.
reviews.comment_workload:
The mid-term and final exams are only multiple choice questions and are quite straight forward. Attending the classes plus a bit of own revision should be alright.

There are no homework or readings.

reviews.author: Sei
reviews.comment_content: 基本Bio,有cell structure, DNA, mitosis and meiosis, living things, biomes and adaptations,etc. 無Bio底都唔會覺得好難,但係識少少Chem會更好,有1個Chapter midterm final都無考過
reviews.comment_teaching:
第一個Professor比較悶同埋成日講d好深既課外Bio,但係其實睇ppt已經可以學到要知既野所以無咩所謂

第二個講書好聽有第二份上堂用既ppt要抄野,又有PRS計Bonus
reviews.comment_grading:
Midterm極輕鬆，睇書做exercise就已經無敵
Final真係要溫書(上堂講個d都要溫熟),同埋要用腦
Midterm後每堂有PRS Bonus,一題加0.2分
所以course total好易就有80+/100

利申：無讀過Bio, course total ~90/100, A
reviews.comment_workload: Midterm前做exercise, Midterm後上堂PRS唔好遲到同埋專心聽書, Final前背下d notes就得

reviews.author: cyc_yin
reviews.comment_content:
前半部分prof wong教既係基本中學bio野，例如cell，基本bio building blocks，營養個D。後半就詳細講DNA，RNA，genes同略略講ecosystem。
又係有上堂就好易明既。
reviews.comment_teaching: 兩個prof都係有心既。不過prof wong成日吹D課外野，無bio底唔明。另外eugene hung既ppt係詳細既，D字密密麻麻，但係我好想叫佢唔好再用comic sans呢隻字體。兩個都樂於解答問題，幾好人。
reviews.comment_grading: mt同final個佔50%，bonus計額外12分，我mt高半個SD，final高0.8個SD，最後總分82%有A－。
reviews.comment_workload: mt既MC都算易，係中學bio同有聽書就知既野。下半部分有PRS計attendance同bonus，不過D人做完即走搞到eugene hung好慶。每堂如果有人問好問題或者答到難問題既話就有bonus。佢既PRS MC又係勁複雜同難。final之前有模擬題目post上Canvas比你試做，final唔考mt之前既野，可以安心。eugene hung既MC唔係人咁品，複雜到呢，要concept超清同細心睇題目先答到。

reviews.author: HU-HT
reviews.comment_content:
First half of the course:
The Study of Life
The Chemical Basis of Life
The Molecules of Life
Cell Structure and Function
Biological membrane
Energy and Enzymes
Cellular Respiration

Second half of the course:
Determination of Form and Function of an Organism
Making of a New Life
Differences among Living Individuals
Vaccines and Antivirals (Special Topic)
reviews.comment_teaching: Both of the lecturers teachings were pretty boring. I really wanted to skip all the lectures but I was afraid that I might miss some information that may appear in the exams.
reviews.comment_grading:
5% Attendance (First half only)
5% Individual Project (Second half)
45% Mid-Term Exam
45% Final Exam
You get some bonus points if you answer questions too (Second half only)

My result:
5/5 Attendance
5/5 Individual Project
41/60 Mid-Term Exam
45/90 Final Exam
0 Bonus point
Grade: B-

Both exams require you to memorize.
I was pretty terrible at memorizing so I struggled pretty hard. I am proud that I got a grade higher than C.
reviews.comment_workload: There was only 1 individual project, and that was also pretty easy too. You can finish it in less than an hour.

reviews.author: BRE
reviews.comment_content:
Syllabus:

Midterm stuff: Dr Tang's part
- The study of Life
- The Chemical Basis of Life/ The molecules of Life
- Cell Structure and Function
- Biological Membranes: Structure and Function
- Energy and Enzymes

Final stuff: Dr Hung's part
- Determination of Form and Function of an Organism
- Making of a New Life
- Differences among Living Individuals
- Special Topic: Viral Infection - Immune Responses, Prevention and Treatment

For Dr Tang's part, you will have to answer in-class clicker question, so attendance is required to get that 5% of the course assessment.
For Dr Hung's part, attendance is not mandatory. But answering questions will reward bonus points.

Content before midterm is more about memorisation. Some very basic chemistry, cellular structures and functions.
Content after midterm will require more understanding and will still make use some of the stuff taught before midterm.

Content to be examined in the midterm and final will not overlap. That is, content learnt before midterm won't be asked directly in final exam. But content taught after midterm will still require some understanding in the content taught before midterm.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Dr Tang's teaching is meh. Her teaching is a bit slow and just reading the power point most of the time.
Dr Hung's teaching is ok. Even though it's a bit slow, his explanation is clear (at least for me).
reviews.comment_grading:
Weighting:
In-class clicker question*: 5%
Individual Project: 5%
Midterm: 45%
Final: 45%
Bonus participation mark**: max 5
*Only in Dr Tang's part. Full mark as long as you answer all the question of the in-class clicker question, no matter correct or not
**In Dr Hung's part. Gain bonuses by answer questions during lecture. Boost at most one sub-grade.

Midterm: All MCs
Mean: 42.9/60
SD 9.31

Final: All MCs
Full mark: 90

Absolute grading, the range maybe adjusted according to the performance.

A+: >=93
A: 87-92.75
A-: 81-86.75
B+: 75-80.75
B: 69-74.75
B-: 63-68.75
C+: 57-62.75
C: 51-56.75
C-:45-50.75
D: 33-44.75
F: <33.

I believe as long as one put some effort in memorising and understanding the material, getting at least a B is not a problem.
reviews.comment_workload: No homework except the individual project in Dr Hung's part. The project is simple and took me less than half an hour to complete.

reviews.author: Norman
reviews.title: Good
reviews.comment_content:
Part I: Organization of Life
The study of life
The Chemical Basis of Life/The Molecules of Life
Cell Structure and Function
Biological membranes: Structure and Function

Part II:
Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms
Energy and Enzymes
Respiration/ revision class

Midterm examination (Parts I & II)

Part III:
Continuity of Life
Determination of Form & Function of an Organism
Making of a New Life

Part IV:
Biodiversity
Differences among Living Individuals
Variety of Living Things on Earth

Final examination (Parts III & IV)
reviews.comment_teaching:
The teaching method is quite interesting (sometimes easily feel asleep because of some concepts, they are boring by themselves).
Their accents are good, easy to follow.
reviews.comment_grading: Fair, absolute grading.
reviews.comment_workload:
Very light.
IPRS questions in Dr.Tang's lectures
and a project from Dr.Hung

reviews.author: usto.o
reviews.comment_content:
Part I: Organization of Life
The study of life
The Chemical Basis of Life/The Molecules of Life
Cell Structure and Function
Biological membranes: Structure and Function

Part II:
Energy Transfer Through Living Organisms
Energy and Enzymes
Respiration/ revision class

Mid- term examination (Parts I & II)

Part III:
Continuity of Life
Determination of Form & Function of an Organism
Making of a New Life

Part IV:
Biodiversity
Differences among Living Individuals
Variety of Living Things on Earth

Final examination (Parts III & IV)
reviews.comment_teaching:
Both teachings are quite boring.
Jessica gave a lot of powerpoint, you need to memorise a lot of things, you can get bonus points if you answer in class clicker questions correctly.
Eugene is quite nice, you can get bonus points if you ask or answer his questions.
If you have any questions, you can send email to ask them.
reviews.comment_grading:
Maybe absolute grading
In class clicker questions
Mid-Term Exam:MC
Final Exam:LQ
reviews.comment_workload:
No assignment, readings, tutorials, and homework.
You need to memorise their powerpoint before mid term and final exam. You need to have a good understanding of the contents as well.

reviews.author: qrcode
reviews.comment_content: Basically about the foundational knowledge of biology, such as structures of DNA, proteins and cells inside human body. Things became little bit challenging after the midterm, we learnt about genes and chromosomes, but it was still manageable for a student without any biology background.
reviews.comment_teaching: Personally, I think Jessica's lessons were more interesting, she would play music during breaks and explained the lecture content in an understandable way. I felt prof hung's lesson a bit boring, he spoke in a very flat tone... but if  you ask him questions through emails or during class, he would explain to you patiently and clearly. So I think both were good.
reviews.comment_grading:
I would say ok, as long as you study for the midterm and final, you will get what you deserve. Jessica's paper was quite straightforward,  while prof hung's was quite challenging.
Midterm: mean (40sth/70)
Final : mean (20sth/50)
Jessica's clicker questions (5%)
I got 63/70 for mt and 39.5/50 for final, got A grade finally
reviews.comment_workload: no workload at all. it's better to attend Jessica's lectures because we had to complete in class clicker questions, which counted 5% towards final grade. But it's up to you whether to attend prof hung's lecture or not.

reviews.author: sammuelwong
reviews.comment_content:
主要都係DSE bio嘢
對bio無興趣 中學又唔係選修bio
會有D難跟上
reviews.comment_teaching:
有啲悶
主要係跟著powerpoint講
佢有時會問問題 答啱會加bonus分
個professor 都幾好人
reviews.comment_grading:
考既内容都幾多
因為係absolute grading
臨考前有稍微睇吓 認真背吓啲筆記
都唔會D或F
不過要攞B+ A可能就難啲
reviews.comment_workload:
冇乜assignment
workload唔大

reviews.author: 23V
reviews.title: EASY COURSE
reviews.comment_content: The content includes basic concepts about the characteristics about life and cell. Though the second half of the course involving contents about genetics is a bit more in depth, the questions asked in the exam is quite easy and straight forward.
reviews.comment_teaching:
Tang is a lively lecturer and can be overly enthusiastic sometimes. The slides provided include all the information required to cope with the exam. The only dissatisfying thing about her teaching is that she is quite a bad joke-teller.
I've only attended two lectures given by Hung, He teaches concisely but he speaks in such a low volume that easily make you lose attention. The slides provided on canvas is a bit different from the ones used in class. He also provides question sets for each section of the syllabus which literally saved my life.
reviews.comment_grading:
This course follows a curve grading system.
The things tested aren't difficult, if you put into a little effort and begin to memorize the things on slides and do all the question sets just the night before the exam, it's easy to get a b range score. However, getting an a will definitely require a deeper understanding of the content.
reviews.comment_workload:
Workload is very light.
Attendance is not mandatory and there's no homework or project (somehow cancelled in this semester).

reviews.author: thisisnotimport
reviews.title: LIFS1901
reviews.comment_content: The course is divided into mainly 2 parts. First part is taught by Professor WONG. It involves general biology knowledge as well as chemistry knowledge. The difficulty is relatively easy. For the second part, it is taught by Dr HUNG. It involve some advance biology knowledge that is based on the first part.
reviews.comment_teaching: Both professors have a dull voice that drives people asleep. The teaching method is the classic "PowerPoint and Talk". Each lecture is video-taped, therefore, it is not really necessary for people to attend lecture (only if you wish to).
reviews.comment_grading: Fairly good grade. Both examinations are in Multiple choices style. The mid-term examination is purely 50 Multiple choice questions with single choice. The mean is around 35. The final examination is little bit tricky, with 25 Multiple choices questions with single choice, 25 Multiple choices questions with multiple choices. The mean is around 35 as well.
reviews.comment_workload: The workload of this course is nearly 0. There is not any assignment besides a so-called "research project" that is actually cancelled in this semester due to insufficient time by Dr HUNG. Originally the project counts 5% towards the course grade. If you wish not to do this project, I recommend you to attend lecture and ask Dr HUNG many questions so that he over-ran and forced to cancel the assignment (lol)

reviews.author: Dreamer
reviews.title: A good but unexpected course
reviews.comment_content: I am a mainland who studied biology in high school. This is the most important reason that I have the courage to enroll this course. Honestly speaking, things I learned in high school cover 90% of LIFS1901, and the rest 10% knowledge is complementary and useful and easy to digest if you study carefully. Generally, this course will truly introduce you to biology from micro to macro. I think it can arouse one's interest in nature to some extent. Well, of course, it depends on the instructor.
reviews.comment_teaching:
I have to say that these two instructors are like the opposite. The former (before midterm) just told the content of ppt, even faster than you could read. The atmosphere was always silent and weird, and the instructor sometimes laughed for something only she herself thought funny. The latter was quite good in comparison (I am not saying she is  
good, just in comparison).She extended the content more and printed the clicker questions in the ppt and even ended the class earlier than expected if everything in the ppt has been taught.
reviews.comment_grading: Just like what I said in the column of "content", high-school knowledge helps a lot. If you are a mainland and learn no bad in biology, come on! If you are not, please refer to other students' comments about this course. There are over 200 students in my class, but the competition is not that exciting and the high-grade owners are basically mainlands and internationals. According to the grade distribution of midterm, almost half of the students cannot pass(get 60% grades). I got A by the way.
reviews.comment_workload: For me, the main workload lies in reciting and remembering the huge amount of vocabulary. By my estimation, there are more than 400 new words. But don't be afraid, you will get familiar with them in the progress of studying. It only takes my time before midterm and final. But if you are a true beginner in biology, well, take care and good luck. You will get a sense of satisfaction and achievement after the whole semester. After all, I prefer to call it LANG1901.

reviews.author: lmacchch
reviews.title: Don't be fooled by the midterm exam
reviews.comment_content: Introduce some basic concepts in biology study, which I have already known before taking the class, but this course introduce those things in a deeper way compared to my high school study
reviews.comment_teaching: To be honest, both professors aren't so good at teaching, but HUNG's teaching is worse than TANG's. Don't depend too much on professors teaching, self-taught study is more important.
reviews.comment_grading:
The grading is fair but is not good.
Scheme: 90+ A+, 85-90 A, just as that
Proportion: 45% midterm, 5% participation for TANG's part, 50% final, some people may get bonus, but the bonus is too small and in fact makes no difference.
The midterm is quite straight forward and I get good scores, but the final is EXTREMELY difficult. Therefore, work hard even though you do a good job in midterm, or you would get good grade.
My scores: 64/70 in midterm, 100/100 in participation, 224/300 in final, 0.5 in bonus -> total 83.8 and will get A-
reviews.comment_workload:
Not compulsory workload at all, just some quizzes and practices for your own reference and practice.
But please take those non-compulsory hw seriously, or you will definitely get bad scores.
